intro: Helipterum spinosum, commonly known as the spiny helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a small annual herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves and produces clusters of small, yellow flowers with five petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. The spiny helipterum is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its resilience to drought conditions.
